sage.event

Class EventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.event.EventManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventManager

    public class EventManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEventManager
    This class implements the IEventManager interface, and it is responsible for sending IGameEvents to all registered IEventListeners.

    Internally EventManager uses a HashMap to maintain registered event listeners. The key of the HashMap is the reflection Class object of an event class that extends AbstractGameEvent.

    Internally EventManager maintains two event queues of type Vector. There is a busy event queue which is the queue currently processing events, and there is the active queue which is the queue where new events are being added to because the busy queue is busy processing events. During each call to the event manager's update() method these two queues will switch.

    This class is setup as a global singleton. To get a reference to the event manager call EventManager.getInstance().

    Author:
    Kenneth Barnett, Mike McShaffry
    See Also:
    Game Coding Complete

        public boolean addListener(IEventListener listener,
                           java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractGameEvent> eventType)
        Registers an IEventListener with the event manager to listen for events of a specific event type.
        Specified by:
        addListener in interface IEventManager
        Parameters:
        listener - - The event listener registering with the event manager.
        eventType - - The type of event the listener is listening for. This is the reflection Class object of an event class that extends AbstractGameEvent.
        Returns:
        True if the listener was successfully registered; False otherwise.

      • update

        public void update(float time)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
